snippet: Attorneys for a man incarcerated for 10 years for a rape say his exoneration by DNA evidence, after months of litigation, proves such data must be made available to defense lawyers.
abstract: Attorneys for Joseph A Buffey, West Virginia man incarcerated for 10 years for rape, say his exoneration by DNA evidence proves such data must be made available to defense lawyers; say, given that it took 18 months of litigation to get state to test DNA evidence against its database of felons, new laws are needed; only nine states have laws granting defendants access to DNA databases.
lead_paragraph: Attorneys for a man incarcerated for 10 years for a rape say his exoneration by DNA evidence, after months of litigation, proves such data must be made available to defense lawyers.

headline.main: Lawyers, Saying DNA Cleared Inmate, Pursue Access to Data
headline.print_headline: Lawyers, Saying DNA Cleared Inmate, Pursue Access to Data
